physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: On envelope: ''#1065 Lillian and Sam Marchick Sam and Ben Marchick.'' On back of photograph: ''Cheyenne, Wyoming Sam Marchick and Sons store, Sandy Viniks maternal grandfather, Same Marchick on left, his son Ben in center.'' On back of second photograph, #1065, Sam Marchick, Joe Marchick, Marchick & Son, Cheyenne.''

mods.abstract: Store owner Sam Marchick, left, his son in center, and an unidentified man and woman at right, in Marchick's Cheyenne, Wyoming store. A sign in back of large trunk reads "Shoe sale - pick em out." Another sign that is displayed between the two Marchick men, states, "Sale on pants." Samuel Marchick and his wife, Lillie (Rice), were born in Ostrovo, Poland. Sam Marchick came to the United States in 1904 and sent for his wife and children: Joseph, Benjamin, Jacob, Mary, Arline and Faye. The family operated a new and used clothing store and a pawn shop, and lived above the store.
